bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from J. L. Farnum to Laura Armistead Carter, December 27, 1929

div1.p: Farnum sends Carter new cards extending her Library of Congress borrowing privileges and shelf access through 1930.

div1.head: Letter from J. L. Farnum to Laura Armistead Carter, December 27, 1929
div1.opener:
Book
Miscl
L. of C.
LIBRARY OF CONGRESS
WASHINGTON
F-SF
OFFICE OF THE LIBRARIAN
December 27 1929
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
In response to your recent request, I am
sending herewith, by direction of the Librarian, re-
newed cards permitting you to draw from the Library
books on history, exploration and medicine, so far as
they may be spared from statutory and reference use,
and access to the stacks containing works on medicine,
yellow fever subjects, travel, exploration, history and
allied subjects, until December 31, 1930.

As you will see, these permits are dated January
1, 1930,- your previous cards (which are returned herewith)
being good until the end of the present month.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, J. L. Farnum Secretary
(4 enclosures)
Miss Laura Armistead Carter
The Westmoreland, 2122 California Street N. W.
Washington D. C.
